page.title: 13MUSIC FESTIVAL-BROADFORD
page.content: The first{Isle of Skye Music Festival} was held in Broadford on June 15th 1985. A crowd of about 3000 people each paid Â£10 to listen to seven bands perform. Danny Kyle introduced The Honky Tonk Ceilidh Band,Phil Cunningham of Silly Wizard,a reggae group called Man at the Window,jazz -funk from Morrisey Mullen,folk from The Boys of the Lough with the top names being John Martyn and Gaelic supergroup{Runrig.}The event cost Â£19000 to stage and lost nearly Â£3500 but was still a roaring success.Cater- ing and dressing facilities were provided by Broadford Primary School and the event took place in the open air on the playing field adjacent.It rained heavily most of the morning and this deterred local attendance. The event was staged by The Village Hall Committee and ran from 11am to 10pm.
